Hey Love Lemur!

We definitely don't want to leave you in isolation without chat!  As to why you don't seem to be able to connect to our Chat Servers, it can be hard to pinpoint.  Because of this, give the following steps a try in order to fix this.

Go to:

C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\[Highest Release Version NUmber]\deploy\preferences

Once here, find your SummonerName.properties files (for example, dArtagnan.properties) and delete it.

Next, open the "global" folder and open the "global.properties" file in notepad. Clear the contents of this file but **DO NOT** delete this file, if you do it will not be recreated. Just delete all of the content in the file then save it.

Let me know if you still can't connect to chat!

> Let me know if you still can't connect to chat!

Oooh. That is some very interesting stuff. Even has second account properties, and previous name properties even after name changes.

Question though. In the very odd event that the "global.properties" file gets deleted for whatever reason, what would happen?? Especially seeing how it won't be recreated. Forever disconnected from chat unless reinstalled completely, or what??

More than likely, you would need to run a repair or perform a re-installation in order to get this file to appear again.  Not the end of the world, but you would probably need to perform some extra steps.

To this end, make sure that you complete all of the steps in our [Connection Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)! If you are still at a lost and have lost all hope in resolving this, don't give up quite yet! {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} Hello all,

I had this issue and tried a slew of different things to resolve the issue and could not fix it so i ended up submitting a support request into riot support and got an answer. (after i resolve the issue many hours later unfortunately.)

The support tech did give me very useful information that i felt needed to be shared here since none of the solutions i found here worked for me especially seeing as how half of them are troll answers that arent even serious and are just going to mess with peoples computer settings in very irritating ways. 

Anyhow here is what he said:  

> This error typically stems from a disconnection between your computer and our game servers. The error message is basically telling you that the "heartbeat" from your computer did not reach our servers in time. The "heartbeat" is a packet of information that needs to be sent to our servers telling them that your computer is still connected to the internet and is active. If the packet does not make it to our servers or is delayed our servers will actually terminate the connection in order to protect your account.
> 
> There are a couple of reasons that the packet might be delayed in reaching our servers. The most common reason is that the packet didn't leave your computer in time. This is typically caused by a large amount of uplink network buffering. Network buffering is a buffer of information that is waiting to be processed. If more information is being received or transmitted than the bandwidth of your computer can handle the information is queued up in the buffer. Sometimes this buffer can become very large and data is not sent out when it's supposed to be. To correct this I would recommend following our knowledge base article here:
> 
> [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq5)
> 
> If you continue to have problems please try to get the following information and attach it to this ticket:
> 
> [**A network analysis**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#wq1)
> 
> [**A network log**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#wq4)
> 
> [**A process list**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#wq3)
> 
> Thank you!
> 
> KramSyhr 
> Player Support Specialist 
> Prefer Support
I was having this problem as well. Switching to google's dns (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4), then flushing the dns cache, and deleting the summoner.properties files seems to have worked for me.
